greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = Sum_{j=k..n} j!, 0 <= k <= n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = Sum_{j=k..n} j!, 0 <= k <= n.
(The above is to be read as matrix product A*D*A where A is lower triangular filled with 1's and D = diag(n!, n >= 0). - _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 26 2020)
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: a:=proc(n,k) local j; add(factorial(j),j=k..n) end: seq(seq(a(n,k),k=0..n),n=0..8); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Oct 16 2018
mathematica: Table[Sum[j!, {j, k, n}], {n, 0, 15}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 15 2018 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0,15, for(k=0,n, print1(sum(j=k,n, j!), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 15 2018
(MAGMA) [[(&+[Factorial(j): j in [k..n]]): k in [0..n]]: n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 15 2018
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ & _Roger L. Bagula_, Jul 26 2008
